aiSuggestions.context: You are helping create a Vue.js Single Page Application. Common patterns include: Single File Components (SFC) with <template>, <script setup>, and <style>, Composition API with ref/reactive, Vue Router for navigation, v-model for two-way binding, computed properties, watchers, lifecycle hooks (onMounted, onUnmounted), Pinia for state management, props and emits for parent-child communication, slots for content projection. Use Composition API (script setup) instead of Options API. Remember .value when accessing ref values in script, but not in template. Use v-if/v-show for conditional rendering, v-for for lists with keys.

commonBugs: Forgetting .value when accessing ref in script - refs need .value in script, not template
Mutating props directly - Props are read-only, use emits to update parent
Missing keys in v-for - Causes rendering issues and performance problems
Memory leaks from watchers - Always clean up watchers in onUnmounted
v-if vs v-show confusion - v-if removes from DOM, v-show just hides
Reactive object mutation - Use reactive() or ensure proper reactivity
Async state updates - Be careful with timing of reactive updates
performanceTips: Use v-show instead of v-if for frequently toggled elements
Use computed instead of methods for derived values
Lazy load routes with dynamic imports
Use v-memo for expensive list rendering
Avoid creating functions in template - use computed or methods

bestPractices.components: One component per .vue file, PascalCase naming
bestPractices.composables: Reusable logic in composables/ folder, prefix with 'use'
bestPractices.state: Use Pinia for global state, ref/reactive for local
